result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Aguilar-Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Hiding a Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.11(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Life sentencing commencing forthwith (10/31/16). Eligible for Extended Supervision after 20 yrs. Def may petition the Court on 10/31/36. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

$518  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections. Restitution to be paid before Court Costs. Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.

Concur to ct 1.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
3/7/17 Crt amends ct 2 to reflect a Class F Felony.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. To be paid before court costs.

$268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

the judgment of conviction and order denying the AguilarVargas's postconviction motion for a new trial are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Dennis Schertz is relieved of any further representation of Aguilar-Vargas in this matter pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $500,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Rudy R.-M., Elmer R.-M., Saul G.-R. or Erlin V. 
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior written permission from the Court.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 11  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-28-2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Joseph E. Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter: Jim Larson.
The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.   The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances
